Title: Media Monitoring and Management for TfGM
Description:
Transport for Greater Manchester is looking to establish a 2 year contract for an integrated media monitoring and management software service.

This will allow all press releases, statements, enquiries, and coverage to be centralised into a unified software platform that can be easily accessed by all members of the team. This will create a logical and integrated workflow for the team, improve efficiency and improve our service to internal and external customers and partners.

This system would include news releases and statements issued to the media; enquiries from journalists; and cuttings from print, online, and broadcast media. This will integrate with an up-to-date contacts database of journalists, and a logging system that allows the team to track activity at a glance, and run bespoke reports as required. 

The following are high level requirements:

Media monitoring:
	Press monitoring;
	Online monitoring; and
	Broadcast monitoring.
Media management:
	Enquiry logging;
	Statement management;
	Distribution of press releases; and
	Database of journalists.
Online newsroom.

To access the tender documentation, submit a response, and raise any clarification questions, please respond to the Expression of Interest on the ProContract ( https://procontract.due-north.com/ ) portal under the opportunity referenced as DN405738.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb:
[Precise Media Monitoring LTD (T/A Kantar Media)|222 Grays Inn Road
London
WC1X 8HB
United Kingdom|COMPANIES_HOUSE|3247942|No|No]

Title: Urban Traffic Control (UTC) Ducting and Minor Highway Works Framework
Description:
(SCOOT/ MOVA) at various locations throughout the Greater Manchester conurbation. SCOOT is Split Cycle
 Offset Optimisation Technique. MOVA is Microprocessor Optimised Vehicle Actuation. To ensure implementation
 of adaptive traffic signal control (SCOOT/ MOVA)
 - To support this TfGM required two suitably experienced contractors to undertake associated civils enabling
 works on a call-off basis, in terms of ducting and other associated minor highways works.
 - The SCOOT/MOVA technology itself will then be installed via a separate Traffic Signal Maintenance contract
 already in place.
 - Following the award of Growth Deal 3 funding it is estimated that this level of funding will enable approximately
 60nr junctions to be improved with site works to commence at the start of 2018 and last until the start of 2020.
 - Other additional funding may also be obtained during the term of the Framework that results in a requirement
 to undertake further works associated with traffic signal junction improvements, these may also be delivered via
 the framework.
 - The contractual arrangement is also intended to be made available for use by other authorities who may
 require works to be delivered via the framework subject to availability of funding. These include the ten
 members of the Association of Greater Manchester Authorities.
 -There is no guarantee given relating to the value of works to be instructed via this framework agreement.

Title: Dr Bike Cycle Maintenance Training Framework
Description:
TfGM is looking to appoint and enter into contract with suppliers for the supply of services as specified in this Invitation to Tender (ITT). 
TfGM wishes to establish a Preferred Supplier List (“PSL”) for the provision of:-
•	LOT 1: Dr Bike sessions 
•	LOT 2: Basic Cycle Maintenance Training carried out at locations throughout Greater Manchester
•	LOT 3: Basic Cycle Maintenance Training carried out at the tenderers own premises
•	LOT 4: Intermediate Cycle Maintenance training carried out at the tenderers own premises
•	LOT 5: Advanced, accredited, industry accepted cycle maintenance training, carried out at fully equipped workshop premises to be supplied by the tenderer

Title: Transport Professional Services Framework
Description:
Provision of transport consultancy services to include the following strategic lots and specialist sub-lots:
Transport Systems (1), Railway Systems (A), Intelligent Transport Systems (B), Public Transport Operations
(C), Transport Strategy (2), Traffic Engineering (D), Development of Transport Policies and Strategies (E),
Transport Appraisal for Funding Decisions (F), Transport Network Modelling (G), Fares, Ticketing and Marketing
Strategy (H), Transport-Related Commercial and Financial Advice (3), Research and Consultation Activity
(4), Transport Surveys and Data Collection (5), Transport Architectural Design Services (6), Transport-related
Civil and Structural Advice and Services (7), Highway Asset and Network Management Professional Services
(I), Structural Engineering (J), Civil Engineering (K), Transport-Wide Engineering Consultancy Services (8),
Programme / Project Management (L), Quantity Surveying (M), Mechanical and Electrical Engineering (N),
Environmental Services (O) and Transport Multi-Disciplinary Services (9)

Title: Disability Design Reference Group
Description:
TfGM is looking to establish a contract for its Disability Design Reference Group (DDRG).  
Initially set up by TfGM in 2008 the DDRG consists of people with experience and expertise of their respective areas of disability.  The DDRG covers a number of different types of impairments - including people who use wheelchairs, people with hearing or sight impairments and people with learning difficulties. TfGM asks their views on a range of options when designing transport initiatives.  Naturally, there is not always a general consensus - designs that are suited to (for example) someone using a wheelchair may not be the best designs for someone with a visual impairment, and vice versa - consulting the DDRG makes it possible for TfGM to qualitatively assess the different design options in a much more balanced way, and to hear arguments and opinions from many different perspectives. 
The DDRG acts as a forum which contributes to the development of TfGM infrastructure and services which contributes to meeting the requirements of the Equality Act.  The DDRG provide advice which helps to ensure an appropriate level of access to TfGM infrastructure, campaigns and services for disabled people.

The management and facilitation of the DDRG through an external supplier ensures the service and advice is independent and without influence.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Breakthrough UK Ltd|L3 9NG|NONE||Yes|No]

Title: Advertising & Network Infrastructure Maintenance
Description:
Centro is seeking suitable suppliers for its Advertising and Network Infrastructure Maintenance contracts that are due to commence on 1st July 2016 for a period of 10 years. This is to replace Centro's existing contracts that expire on 30th June 2016.
The contracts consist of the following Lots:
- Lot 1 Roadside Asset Advertising
- Lot 2 Commercialisation of Assets
- Lot 3 Infrastructure Cleaning & Audit
- Lot 4 Highway Infrastructure Maintenance
- Lot 5 Highway Infrastructure Supply, Install
- Lot 6 Grounds Maintenance
- Lot 7 Timetable cases.
Bidders can submit tenders for any or all of the Lot(s) above. Tenders are due back by the closing date of 1000 on Thursday 24th March 2016 and the deadline for clarification questions is 12 noon on Monday 7th March 2016. Centro is holding pre-tender Briefing Sessions for all interested bidders commencing at 1400 on Tuesday 23rd February 2016 and 1030 on Wednesday 24th February 2016 at Centro House, Birmingham. If either of these are of interest would you please confirm your attendance by 1700 on Monday 22nd February 2016.
It is Centro's intention to make the contracts available to other local authorities in the UK.
This will consist of the following:
- all county councils, borough and district councils and unitary authorities throughout England, Northern Ireland, Scotland and Wales (please see: - www.direct.gov.uk/en/DI1/Directories/Localcouncils/AToZOfLocalCouncils/index.htm)
- West Midlands Integrated Transport Authority
- West Midlands Passenger Transport Executive

Each of these organisations will contract directly with the successful suppliers. There is, however, no obligation on any other Contracting Authorities to utilise any of these contracts.   
Please note that all communications in relation to these contracts will be through BravoSolution, Centro's e-tendering portal (please see https://centro.bravosolution.co.uk and the attached document outlining how to register for more details), which is also the location to download all tender documents and upload bidder responses, no other means of communication will be accepted. 
If you require any further assistance please consult the online help, or contact the eTendering help desk.

Title: 1-966 Smart Motorway / UTC /AQ Linking study
Description:
In the North West the delivery of the Smart Motorway has increased the capacity of the Strategic Road Network, and therefore, is having a significant impact on the associated junctions which are managed by the Local Highway Authority partners. There is increasing political discussion around the importance of delivering robust and reliable junctions following the introduction of Smart Motorways. To enhance the operation of these junctions it is identified from a previous study that linking the Smart Motorway operating system with the Local Highway Authorities Urban Traffic Control (UTC) system could deliver an integrated network management with collective benefits. Therefore, as part of this investigation into the integration of the operating systems, it is proposed that a Proof of Concept (PoC) is delivered. 
There are underlying Air Quality challenges in Greater Manchester associated with both the SRN and local road network. Highways England has an Air Quality Strategy which has a number of objectives including the dynamic management of traffic both on, and beyond, the SRN. Interventions have been identified by both Highways England and Transport for Greater Manchester (TfGM). However, none of the proposed measures are exploring collaborative operating regimes.
Highways England is consequently seeking to appoint an appropriate consultant with experience of the Collaborative Traffic Management programme, direct involvement in the development of the Smart Motorway operating regime and an understanding of the Air Quality assessment methods (including involvement in the AQ assessment of the Manchester Smart Motorway scheme). The appointment will be for the provision of technical services.

Title: Alleviating Congestion by Travel Demand Management Measures
Description: Highways England is looking to set up a contract for the provision of a Research and Development project, to be delivered via the SPaTS Framework. The project will develop a range of capabilities which will benefit operations both within Highways England and within key stakeholders, including Transport for Greater Manchester (TfGM), Transport for the West Midlands (TfWM) and Solent Transport. The scope of these operational capabilities is set out in Section 3 below.
